verses.text: 堅心倚靠 神可保安穩 （大衛的詩。）耶和華是我的亮光，是我的救恩，我還怕誰呢？耶和華是我性命的避難所，我還懼誰呢？（本節在《馬索拉抄本》包括細字標題）

words.note: Capitalized '神' often refers to the singular God in biblical context.

verses.text: 那些作惡的，就是我的敵人、我的仇敵，他們逼近我，要吃我肉的時候，就絆跌仆倒。

words.note: More formal/archaic than 敵人, often used in religious texts.
An idiom describing a complete fall or defeat.

verses.text: 雖有軍兵紮營攻擊我，我的心也不害怕；雖然發動戰爭攻擊我，我仍舊安穩。
有一件事我求過耶和華，我還要尋求；我要一生一世住在耶和華的殿裡，瞻仰他的榮美，在他的殿中求問。

words.note: An idiom emphasizing duration, often translated as 'all my life' or 'forever'.
Often used in respectful contexts, like admiring a deity or revered figure.

verses.text: 因為在我遭難的日子，他必把我藏在他的帳棚裡，把我隱藏在他帳幕的隱密處，又把我高舉在磐石上。

words.note: A more formal or religious term for tent, often referring to the Tabernacle.

verses.text: 現在，我可以抬起頭來，高過我四周的仇敵；我要在他的帳幕裡，獻上歡呼的祭；我要歌唱，頌讚耶和華。
耶和華啊！我發聲呼求的時候，求你垂聽；求你恩待我，應允我。

words.note: Indicates the preceding clause modifies the following noun.
A polite request phrase, often treated as a unit.
A polite request phrase, often treated as a unit.

verses.text: 你說：「你們要尋求我的面！」那時我的心對你說：「耶和華啊！你的面我正要尋求。」

words.note: Often used metaphorically for presence or favor in biblical context.
Often used metaphorically for presence or favor in biblical context.

words.definition: just about to, indeed want to

verses.text: 求你不要向我掩面，不要發怒趕逐你的僕人，你一向是幫助我的。拯救我的 神啊！求你不要撇下我，也不要離棄我。

words.note: A polite request phrase, often treated as a unit.
In the Bible, God hiding His face often implies displeasure.
Turns the preceding verb into a noun-like phrase ('the one who helps me').
Often preceded by a blank space (　) in Chinese Bibles for reverence.
A polite request phrase, often treated as a unit.

verses.text: 雖然我的父母離棄我，耶和華卻收留我。
耶和華啊！求你指示我你的道路；為我仇敵的緣故引導我走平坦的路。
求你不要照著我敵人的心願，把我交給他們，因為有作假見證的人起來攻擊我，並且口出兇暴的話。

words.note: A biblical idiom for testifying falsely.

verses.text: 我還是相信，在活人之地，我可以看見耶和華的恩惠。

words.note: Often used in biblical context as 'the land of the living'.
Literary equivalent of '的'.

verses.text: 你要等候耶和華，要剛強，要堅定你的心，要等候耶和華。

words.note: Often used in religious contexts for waiting on God.
A common exhortation in the Bible.
Repeated for emphasis, a key theme in this Psalm.
